alert.note: Alert for Los Angeles (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 10 at 3:28PM PST until March 10 at 9:00PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest California, including southeast Los Angeles County * WHEN...Until 700 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 320 PM PST, Doppler radar indicated moderate to heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that could experience flooding include... Long Beach, Wrightwood, Whittier, West Covina, Glendora, Inglewood, San Dimas, Pomona, Torrance, Redondo Beach, Hermosa Beach, Manhattan Beach, Rancho Palos Verdes, Carson, and La Verne. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
